description:
### ContainsNearbyAlmostDuplicate

This java function checks if a given array of numbers, nums, has two indices i and j such that the absolute difference between nums[i] and nums[j] is less than or equals to t, and the absolute difference between i and j is less than or equals to k. It returns true in case such pair of indices exists, otherwise it returns false.

Input: An array of integers nums, an integer k and another integer t.
Output: Returns boolean, true if the conditions are met, false otherwise.

Example:

``` containsNearbyAlmostDuplicate([1, 3, 1], 2, 1); // true ```
